metadata.Title: CVE-2013-5738 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The get_allowed_mime_types function in wp-includes/functions.php inWordPress before 3.6.1 does not require the unfiltered_html capability foruploads of .htm and .html files, which might make it easier for remoteauthenticated users to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via acrafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5738` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.1+dfsg-1').
